info.title: Wild Apricot API for non-administrative access
info.description: Wild Apricot API for non-administrative access

get.description:
Base URL for this API. It provides a list of resources,
which can be directly accessed by URL without providing any additional
information like account ID etc.

200.description: Array of resources

401.description: oAuth token was not provided, invalid or does not provide access to requested URL.

get.description: List of accounts available with current oAuth token. Typically, there would be only one record in an array.

200.description: Array of accounts

401.description: oAuth token was not provided, invalid or does not provide access to requested URL.

429.description: On too many requests from same account. Wait for a minute and try again.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Your account identifier

200.description: Array of accounts

401.description: oAuth token was not provided, invalid or does not provide access to requested URL.

429.description: On too many requests from same account. Wait for a minute and try again.

get.description:
Retrieves or updates contact information. Results can be filtered using filter criteria consisting of fields, operators, and values.
Large lists can be retrieved with in sets or pages using $top and $skip parameters.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Current account identifier

parameters.name: simpleQuery
parameters.description: A search string used to filter contacts list.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
An expression to filter contacts. Possible field names to filter contacts are
**Id** - A list of contact IDs. Supports operation **in**. E.g. `$filter=Id in [1,3,5,7,9]`

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description:
Fields to be returned for each contact. If not specified, no custom fields will be returned.
The field names correspond to the fields returned by the [ContactFields API call](#/Contacts/get_accounts__accountId__contactfields), not the field names that appear in Wild Apricot. Multiple field names are separated by commas, and field names with spaces or special characters are enclosed in single quotation marks.
Example `$select='First name','Last name','My favorite book'`

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description:
This parameter specifies the number of records to be skipped. For example, if the result set contains 200 records and $skip=50, then the call will return records 51 to 150.

Usually used together with **$top** parameter.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description:
Specifies the maximum number of records to be returned. For example, if the result set contains 100 records and $top=50, then the call will return records from 1 to 50. If omitted or set more than 100 then maximum 100 items returned
Usually this parameter used together with $skip parameter.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: Append this parameter to a search request to retrieve the number of contacts returned by the search.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description:
Retrieve specific contacts.

E.g. `ids=1,2,3`

parameters.name: idsOnly
parameters.description: If specified, the call returns a list of contact IDs for the filtered contacts. In this case, the response will contain only the ContactIdentifiers field.

200.description: A wrapper object, which contains a list of contacts, or the number of contacts, or a list of contact IDs.

400.description: On invalid parameters. See error details in response body.

401.description: oAuth token was not provided, invalid or does not provide access to requested URL.

428.description: Current user should accept terms of use before using API. It can be done in web interface, or by making a POST request to /rpc/{accountId}/acceptTermsOfUse

429.description: On too many requests from same account. Wait for a minute and try again.

get.summary: Retrieve list of events visible to the current user.
get.description: Retrieve list of events visible to the current user.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Your account identifier

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
An expression to filter events. Possible field names to filter events are

**Id** - A list of event IDs. Supports operation **in**. E.g. `$filter=Id in [1,3,5,7,9]`

**RegistrationEnabled** - Indicates whether registration has been enabled for the event. Supports operations **eq** and **ne**. E.g. `RegistrationEnabled eq true`

**IsUpcoming** - Indicates whether the event has yet to take place. Supports operations **eq** and **ne**. E.g. `IsUpcoming eq false`

**StartDate** - The start date of the event (using the yyyy-mm-dd date format). Supports operations **eq**, **ne**, **gt**, **ge**, **lt**, **le**. E.g. `StartDate gt 2016-01-02`

**EndDate** - The end date of the event (using  the  yyyy-mm-dd date format). Supports operations **eq**, **ne**, **gt**, **ge**, **lt**, **le**. E.g. `EndDate le 2016-01-02`

**TextIndex** - Returns events that contain the specified string within the event title, description, location, start date, or event tag. Supports operation **substringof**. E.g. `$filter=substringof(TextIndex,'some text to look for')`

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description:
This parameter specifies the number of records to be skipped. For example, if the result set contains 100 records and $skip=50, then the call will return records 51 to 150.

Usually used together with **$top** parameter.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description:
Specifies the maximum number of records to be returned. For example, if the result set contains 100 records and $top=50, then the call will return records from 1 to 50. If omitted or set more than 100 then maximum 100 items returned.
Usually this parameter used together with $skip parameter.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: Append this parameter to a search request to retrieve the number of items.

parameters.name: idsOnly
parameters.description: If specified, the call returns a list of event IDs for the filtered events. In this case, the response will contain only the EventsIdentifiers field.

200.description: Returns list of filtered events

400.description: On invalid parameters. See error details in response body.

401.description: oAuth token was not provided, invalid or does not provide access to requested URL.

428.description: Current user should accept terms of use before using API. It can be done in web interface, or by making a POST request to /rpc/{accountId}/acceptTermsOfUse

429.description: On too many requests from same account. Wait for a minute and try again.

parameters.name: $top

CreatedDate.description: Date and time when the file has been uploaded.

AppForMembersAvailable.description: Indicates whether an app for members available or not. It's not available for free accounts.

EnableAppForMembers.description: Indicates whether an app for members enabled in settings or not

EnableEventsList.description: Indicates whether an event list is available

EnableMemberDirectory.description: Indicates whether a member directory is available

VerifyRegistrationCodeParams.description: Set of parameters for event registration code verification

replyToName.description: Name used when replying to the message.

replyToEMail.description: Email address used when replying to the message.

SendMessageRequest.description: Set of parameters for sending private message to contact/member

membershipLevelId.description: ID of membership level to apply for

fieldValues.description: Field values for membership application form

MembershipApplication.description: Set of parameters to apply for membership

fieldValues.description: Field values for membership renewal form

RenewParameters.description: Set of parameters to apply for renewal

Url.description: Address of API call providing account details.

PrimaryDomainName.description: The primary domain name for the account.

Count.description: Number of contacts found. Value appears only if $count was passed in parameters.

ContactsResponse.description: Contains a collection of contacts or number of contacts or list of contact identifiers, depending on passed query parameters.

Contact.description: Contact / member data. Optional fields can be omitted if value is null or if the fields are restricted from viewing.

Id.description: Contact ID of the current contact.

MembershipStateDescription.description: Describes details of current membership status

ContactMe.description: Brief information about the current user.

MembershipLevelPaymentMethod.description: Payment method for applications, renewals and upgrades for this membershipLevel.

FieldName.description: Field name. Can be changed by administrator, so it is not recommended to identify fields by their names.

FieldOrder.description: Field order as described in forms.

SystemCode.description: Unique identifier of field, so it can be used as a key to find custom field value record in a list.

Value.description: Field value. Can be of type string, number, object or array. See related ContactField.

FieldName.description: Field name to display on UI. It can be edited by administrator.

SystemCode.description:
System-defined code associated with the field. It does not change even if
FieldName is modified

DisplayType.description:
Optional hint, which tells how to display and edit field. It appears
for String and Choice fields.

AdminOnly.description: Indicates that the field is accessible only by administrator.

ExistsInLevels.description: Collection of membership levels (Id+Url pairs) where the field exists.

AllowedValues.description: List of allowed values for this field. Appears for Choice / MultipleChoice fields.

Order.description: Sorting order to display the field in UI

MemberOnly.description: The field exists only for members.

IsBuiltIn.description:
The field is built-in system field, its definition can't be edited or
deleted.

SupportSearch.description:
If true, then this field can be used in $filter expression in contact
search.

IsIncludedInRenewal.description: If true, then this field is shown in renewal form.

AllowToChangeInRenewal.description: If true, then this field is allowed to be changed in renewal form.

ExtraCost.description: Price of item, when applying for membership or registering for event.

CustomFieldRulesAndTermsInfo.title: RulesAndTermsInfo

Link.description: Url of rules and terms document.

CustomFieldRulesAndTermsInfo.description:
Additional info for fields with rules / terms conditions. Not present
for other field types.

ExtraChargeMultiplierType.description:
Description of multiplier field.
  ItemPrice multiplier specifies a price for each requested item.
  Percentage multiplier specifies the percentage of the field value to use as extra charge.

CustomFieldExtraChargeInfo.title: ExtraChargeOptions

Multiplier.description: value of multiplier for extra charge calculation

MinAmount.description:
Minimum amount of items to request (minimal field value). Applies to
ItemPrice multiplier type only.

MaxAmount.description: Maximum amount of items to request (maximum field value). Applies to ItemPrice multiplier type only.

MinCharge.description:
Minimum extra charge. Applies to
Percentage multiplier type only.

MaxCharge.description:
Maximum extra charge. Applies to
Percentage multiplier type only.

CustomFieldExtraChargeInfo.description: This property applies to CalculatedExtraCharge fields only.

Value.description: Full value (amount) of this invoice, using account's primary currency.

DocumentDate.description: Date and time when invoice was created

FullyPaid.description: Indicates whether invoice is fully paid

InvoiceOrderType.description: A reason for creating the invoice.

Price.description: Sum to pay for this a single item. Can be negative in case of discount.

Amount.description: total gross amount including all taxes

RoundedAmount.description: rounded total amount including all taxes

SalesTax.description: Taxes applied to the invoice according to account Tax Rules settings.

Value.description: Full value (amount) of this payment, using account's primary currency.

DocumentDate.description: Date and time payment was received.

AllocatedValue.description: Sum of payment already allocated to existing invoices.

RefundedAmount.description: Amount of a refund assigned to the payment.

InvoiceIds.description: Collection of identifiers of invoices to be paid

PaymentMethodType.description: An ID of payment method - one of methods from getAllowedPaymentMethodTypes call

RedirectUrl.description: An URL to redirect to after successfully entering payment info

PaymentStatus.description: Current status of payment started with startPayment api call

EventIdentifiers.description: List of identifiers of events found.

Count.description: Number of events found. Value is returned only if $count was passed in parameters.

EventsResponse.description: Contains a collection of events or number of events or list of event identifiers, depending on passed query parameters.

Location.description: The location or address where event will take place.

StartDate.description: Date and optionally time when event starts.

StartTimeSpecified.description: Indicates whether start time was explicitly specified in StartDate. Value of false means StartDate contains date only.

EndDate.description: Date and optionally time when event completes.

EndTimeSpecified.description: Indicates whether end time was explicitly specified in EndDate. Value of false means EndDate contains date only.

RegistrationEnabled.description: Indicates whether event is enabled for registration.

RegistrationsLimit.description: The registration limit for this event.

Sessions.description: Collection of event sessions for multisession events.

TimeZoneDescription.description: The timezone where an event will take place. If missing, then default timezone for this account is  used.

EventWaitlistSettings.description: provides event waitlist settings and could be nullable

EventWaitlistType.description: it describes waitlist registration behaviour (Undefined value is unexpected)

EventWaitlistInformationToCollect.description: it describes reqired information for register in waitlist (Undefined value is unexpected)

RegistrationTypes.description: A list of available registration types (tickets). The list contains only types visible to current user.

EventRegistrationFields.description: Collection of fields for registration form.

allOf.description: Link to a contact designated as the event organizer.

IsWaitlistEnabled.description: Shows if waitlist enabled for event

IsAutoCancelRegistrationEnabled.description: Shows if registration will be automatically canceled if not paid in specific timeout

RegistrationAutoCancelTimeout.description: Number of minutes to pay for created event registration.

MultipleRegistrationAllowed.description: Indicates whether a single contact can register multiple times for the event.

RegistrationsPaidCount.description: The current number of paid registrants for this event.

RegistrationsUnpaidCount.description: The current number of unpaid registrants for this event.

RegistrationsCanceledCount.description: The current number of canceled registrants for this event.

RegistrationsFreeCount.description: The current number of free registrants for this event.

RegistrationsPartiallyPaidCount.description: The current number of partially paid registrants for this event.

RegistrationsWithNoInvoiceCount.description: The current number of registrants without invoice for this event.

RegistrationsOnWaitlistCount.description: The current number of waitlisters for this event.

EventRegistrationStatistics.description: All registrations on event distinguished by kind.

EventRegistrationsPublicVisibility.description: Indicates who can see event registrants.

EventPaymentMethod.description: Payment method for registrations for this event.

StartDate.description: Date and optionally time when event session starts.

StartTimeSpecified.description: Indicates whether start time was explicitly specified in StartDate. A value of false means StartDate contains date only.

EndDate.description: Date and optionally time when event session ends.

EndTimeSpecified.description: Indicates whether end time was explicitly specified in EndDate. A value of false means EndDate contains date only.

AvailableForRegistration.description: Indicates whether this registration type is enabled user

CodeRequired.description: Indicates whether registration code is required to register.

MaximumRegistrantsCount.description: Maximum number of attendees for this registration type.

IsWaitlistEnabled.description: Shows is waitlist enabled for registration type

MultipleRegistrationAllowed.description: Indicates whether a single contact can register multiple times for this event.

CurrentRegistrantsCount.description: The current number of registrants for this registration type.

AvailableFrom.description: The first day on which this registration type is available.

AvailableThrough.description: The last day on which this registration type is available.

CancellationDaysBeforeEvent.description: Number of days when cancellation available before event started and CancellationBehavior is AllowUpToPeriodBeforeEvent.

Location.description: Location / address where event will take place

RegistrationPublicInfos.description: List of public event registration infos found.

Identifiers.description: List of event registration IDs found.

Count.description: Number of registrations found. Value appears only if $count was passed in parameters.

EventAttendeesResponse.description: Contains a collection of attendees or number of attendees or list of of attendee identifiers, depending on passed query parameters.

ContactId.description: Id of contact with public-enabled membership (absent if registration contact is not a member or profile not enabled to public).

RegistrationDate.description: Date and time when registration was created. (Account local time)

RegistrationFee.description: Total registration fee, including all taxes and discounts.

PaidAmount.description: The value that was already paid.

ShowToPublic.description: Indicates whether to include this registrant in the public list of registrants.

HasChildRegistrations.description: Indicates whether there are event registrations with parent registration id equal to id of current registration. In order to get child registrations make a call to /accounts/XXX/eventregistrations?parentRegistrationId=YYY

NumberOfGuests.description: Number of guests in this registration. This number does not include child registrations.

EventRegistration.description: A record of registration for an event.

FieldName.description: Field name to display on UI. It can be edited by administrator.

SystemCode.description:
System-defined code associated with field. It does not change even if
FieldName is edited

DisplayType.description:
Optional hint, which tells how to display and edit field. It appears
for String and Choice fields.

AllowedValues.description: List of allowed values for this field. Appears for Choice / MultipleChoice fields.

Order.description: Sorting order to display the field in UI

CustomFieldAccessLevel.description:
Default access level for the field. Describes who can access this
field.

RegistrationTypeAccessLevel.description: Whether this registration type is available for Everyone or just MembersOnly.

EventRegistrationFieldKind.description: Common - field is a part of contact fieldset. Custom - field is specific to event.

StartFromJoinDate.description: If true, renewal dates are calculated starting from join date. Otherwise,  renewal dates are specified in Dates field.

YearPeriod.description: For EveryNYears renewal, specifies number of years between renewals.

Dates.description: Renewal dates during a year. For monthly renewals, it contains 12 records.

Active.description: Limit renewal to within certain period

RenewalPeriodKind.description: How often membership should be renewed

MembershipFee.description: The membership fee for one renewal period. See RenewalPeriod setttings for details.

BundleMembersLimit.description: Maximum number of bundle members. Empty for individuals.

AutomaticRecurringPayments.description: For levels with renewal period != Never. If true then membership will be automatically renewed and user charged each next membership period.

MemberCanChangeToLevels.description: Collection of membership levels that members on this level can change to.

DiscountCouponExists.description: is there any applicable discount coupon

TrackingIdentifier.description: Identifier of credit card payment to track payment progress

PaymentPageUrl.description: URL of page to enter payment information, like credit card data or PayPal password

Description.description: Optional text description of the resource.

AllowedOperations.description:
Collection of allowed operations for this resource. Possible values are:
GET - Resource can be requested
POST - Resource can be created
PUT - Resource can be updated
DELETE - Resource can be deleted

Id.description: Unique event registration identifier. Required while updating existing registration. Should not be included when creating new registration.

EventId.description: Related event identifier. Required when creating new registration. Will be ignored while updating existing registration.

RegistrationTypeId.description: Selected registration type identifier. Required when creating new registration.

ParentRegistrationId.description: For guest registrations: parent registration identifier. Will be ignored when updating existing registration.

ShowToPublic.description: Indicates whether the registrant is included in the public list of event registrants.

ForWaitList.description: Indicates whether the registration is for new Wait List entry

NumberOfGuests.description: The number of guests for this registration, if guest registrations are set up to collect only the total number of guests.

RegistrationCode.description: The registration code for this event.

PaymentMethodType.description: An ID of payment method - one of methods from getAllowedPaymentMethodTypes call. If not set then invoice will be sent to registrant's email.

EventRegistrationParams.description: A record of registration for an event.

message.description: An explanation of why this error occured

details.description: More information about the error. Data structure is specific for each error kind.

badRequest.description: On invalid parameters. See error details in response body.

unauthorized.description: oAuth token was not provided, invalid or does not provide access to requested URL.

tooManyRequests.description: On too many requests from same account. Wait for a minute and try again.

termsOfUseRequired.description: Current user should accept terms of use before using API. It can be done in web interface, or by making a POST request to /rpc/{accountId}/acceptTermsOfUse

OAuth2_autorizationCode.description:
Use this flow to get token by authorization through your organization web site login form.

 - Replace YOUR_ORGANIZATION to valid domain name.
 - Allow SSO for your authorized application.
 - Add your web application redirect url to list of trusted domains for that application.

 See also `http://gethelp.wildapricot.com/en/articles/200`

scopes.auto: autodetect allowed scopes based on current user permissions

OAuth2_password.description:
Use this authentication flow to get oauth token by providing user credentials.
clientId and clientSecret should be taken from Authorized applications page in admin backend.

For example if your if your emails is admin@yourdomain.com and password is 123456.
you should pass
`username=admin@yourdomain.com&password=12345&&scope=auto`

scopes.auto: autodetect allowed scopes based on current user permissions
